newsitem.title: ITALY: Italian PM warns of forex threat to interest rates.
newsitem.headline: Italian PM warns of forex threat to interest rates.

text.p: Italian Prime Minister Romano Prodi warned on Tuesday that recent turbulance in the currency markets might have a knock-on impact on European interest rates.

"The exchange rate turbulance that is characterising the international foreign exchange markets should not be underestimated for the possible effect they could have on European interest rates," Prodi said.
He made his comments in a written document presented at a meeting of unions and employers over welfare reform. The meeting was the last before the summer break.
The dollar briefly breached the 1,800 lire level on Monday -- its highest rate against the Italian currency since October 1985.
Prodi said in the document that the markets were showing a growing trust in Italy, particularly because of a sustained slowing of inflation and a recent cut in the discount rate.
